subject: Re: Mobile JUnit
msgSnippet: ... OK.  Thanks for all your help Kent.  Much appreciated :-)  Now, I wonder if my old laptop will connect to my network... Kind regards. Jim.
messageBody:
:-)

OK. Thanks for all your help Kent. Much appreciated :-) Now, I
wonder if my old laptop will connect to my network...

Kind regards.

Jim.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent Mitchell" <kent@...> wrote:
>
> I confirmed that the JUnit jar appears to be unmodified based on a
> cursory examination. I've also confirmed that if you could execute the
> windows installer it seems to be a pretty normal set of java jars and
> the corresponding runner does not look that complicated.
>
> However, I cannot offer to send them to you because the Sony EULA does
> not allow redistribution :-(. At least based on how how I read the
> EULA. Now if you have a windows machine or can run an emulator .....
>
> Kent
>
> ________________________________
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> jimmack_oss
> Sent: Wednesday, July 26, 2006 3:34 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Re: Mobile JUnit
>
>
>
> Thanks Kent :-)
>
> Having looked in more detail at the Common Public License (CPL),
> under which JUnit is distributed, I think that your summary is correct.
>
> If any Windows users could confirm that the JUnit provided in the
> distribution is "unmodified", then I'll leave it alone and just
> grumble under my breath about the lack of support (from Sony Ericsson)
> for Linux ;-)
>
> Thanks again.
>
> Kind regards.
>
> Jim.
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> , "Kent
> Mitchell" <kent@> wrote:
> >
> > If you take what this says at face value that they are distributing
> > "unmodified JUnit Binary code". So they they must be distributing
> their
> > code as a set of additional modules (jars, classes) on top of JUnit.
> By
> > my reading of the license ,they are not required to distribute the
> > source to their work since it is not a "contribution" to the "Program"
> > (i.e. JUnit). So they do have to make the source to JUnit available
> > (which they seem to be complying with) but they do not have to make
> the
> > source code to their additions available.
> >
> > I'm not a lawyer but I do spend a fair amount of time looking at
> license
> > agreements since our products incorporate open source so I've gotten
> > pretty good at reading these things over the years. Does anyone want
> to
> > educate me on where I went wrong with my reasoning?
> >
> > Kent
> >
> >
> > ________________________________
> >
> > From: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> ] On
> Behalf Of
> > David Saff
> > Sent: Wednesday, July 26, 2006 11:25 AM
> > To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> > Subject: Re: [junit] Mobile JUnit
> >
> >
> >
> > Once you run the exe, which is a self-installer, you get, among other
> > things, a text file stating:
> >
> >
> ************************************************************************
> > *
> >
> ************************************************************************
> > *
> >
> > This Software includes unmodified JUnit binary code developed under
> the
> > Common Public License Version 1.0 (CPL). The terms of the CPL are
> > available at
> > http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php
> <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php>
> > <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php
> <http://www.opensource.org/licenses/cpl.php> > . With respect to such
> > binary
> > code,
> > source code can be obtained by e-mailing devsupport@
> > <mailto:devsupport%40sonyericsson.com> .
> >
> >
> ************************************************************************
> > *
> >
> ************************************************************************
> > *
> >
> > I don't have enough brainpower right now to make a legal judgement,
> just
> >
> > adding information.
> >
> > David Saff
> >
> > jimmack_oss wrote:
> > > Hi all,
> > >
> > > I was wondering if anyone could confirm my suspicion that Sony
> > > Ericsson are behaving badly. They have produced something they call
> > > "Mobile JUnit" and they have made it available for download here:
> > >
> http://developer.sonyericsson.com/site/global/docstools/java/p_java.jsp
> <http://developer.sonyericsson.com/site/global/docstools/java/p_java.jsp
> >
> > >
> > > The problem is, the file is a Windows .exe contained in a .zip.
> > > That's no good to me on Linux. Aren't they contravening the open
> > > source license of JUnit by producing their own extension and not
> > > making the source code available?
> > >
> > > Your comments would be greatly appreciated :-)
> > >
> > > Kind regards.
> > >
> > > Jim.
> > >
>
>
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
